intro: Omphalobium patrisii, commonly known as the Patrisii sallybell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems and produces small, bean-like pods that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
